Posts.Content: vgal wrote: I'm 35 with a stong history of BC in family. Went in for first mammo last week and report came back with prominent cluster of pleomorphic microcalcification in left breast and less prominent cluster in right and a Birads Category 4. It seems as though everything I read with pleomorphic tends to be more to the malignant side of things. I go to the breast specialist tomorrow to talk about biopsy, but really seem to be losing my cool while waiting. My mom passed away 3 yrs ago to BC along with my grandmother.Has anyone else had a similar finding on mammo and if so, what were your results. Thanks for any info, support, etc. I can't stand the waiting!!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Really scared vgal HeatherBLocklear

Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2008 09:25AM vgal wrote: Thanks for the encouragement. I think yesterday was my "flip out" day. I'm mentally exhausted but will get through today and the next throughout this crazy journey.
Posts.Title: Really scared vgal HeatherBLocklear

Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2008 06:41PM vgal wrote: Met with the surgeon today and really liked the practice. She has scheduled me for biopsy on both breasts friday and will have the results back on monday. Other than the microcals they found what appeared from the radiologist as just a normal cyst. Today, the dr said she didn't like the appearance of the cyst/lump and it appears to be associated with the microcals. They also found some microcals in the right but are sending me back tomorrow to have a full diagnostic mammo on that side. Other than the worry, I am overall pleased with the quickness. They rearranged some schedules to get me in on Friday.
Posts.Title: Really scared vgal HeatherBLocklear

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2008 07:52AM vgal wrote: Good news, everything is B-9. That was surely the longest 2 weeks of my life. Thanks everyone for the support. It was greatly appreciated!!!!
Posts.Title: Really scared vgal HeatherBLocklear
